metadata.Title: CVE-2018-7453 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
Infinite recursion in AcroForm::scanField in AcroForm.cc in xpdf 4.00 allows attackers to launch denial of service via a specific pdf file due to lack of loop checking, as demonstrated by pdftohtml.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2018-7453` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.62.0-1ubuntu1
libpoppler-cpp0v5 - 0.62.0-1ubuntu1
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.62.0-1ubuntu1
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.62.0-1ubuntu1
libpoppler111 - 0.62.0-1ubuntu1
poppler-utils - 0.62.0-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> xpdf in koffice is 2.0 mdeslaur> code isn't in poppler

criterions.comment: ipe package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
libextractor package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
poppler package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.62.0-1ubuntu1').
xpdf package in impish is affected and needs fixing.
